document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Armascirus (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from Slovakia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Armascirus (Acari: Prostigmata: Cunaxidae) from Slovakia

heading.emphasis:
Key to the females of
Armascirus

paragraph.keyLead: 2 ( 1 ) Hysterosomal median shield small or large, complemented with setae............................................ 3
- Hysterosomal median shield small, not complemented with setae............................................... 23
- Two or more pairs of setae on hysterosomal median shield..................................................... 20

5 ( 4 ) Setae c
1
very short, the distance between the bases of c
1
– c
1
20 times the length of c
1
; venter caudally from coxae II with 5 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae)......................................
A. rafalskii Michocka

- Setae c
1
longer, the distance between the bases of c
1
– c
1
less than 10 times the length of c
1
; venter caudally from coxae II with other number of pairs (not 5 ) of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae)............................... 6

6 ( 5 ) Venter caudally from coxae II with 4 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae), hysterosomal median shield nearly quadrate, coxal formula
I–IV 3 - 2
-3- 2 sts, palpal genu with 1 apophysis and 3 spine-like setae..........................................................................................
A. bahiaensis Den Heter & Castro
- Venter caudally from coxae II with 6 or more pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae).............. 7
7 ( 6 ) The distance between caudal parts of hysterosomal lateral platelets wider than the distance between their frontal parts...... 8
- The distance between caudal parts or hysterosomal lateral platelets shorter than the distance between their frontal parts.... 10

8 ( 7 ) Lateral hysterosomal platelets equal to or longer than hysterosomal median shield; venter caudally from coxae II with 6 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae).............................
A. jasmine Bashir, Afzal & Khan

- Lateral hysterosomal platelets shorter than hysterosomal median shield; venter caudally from coxae II with 7 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae)............................................................... 9

9 ( 8 ) Palpal genua with 3 spls, 1 sts...................................................
A. akhtari Bashir, Afzal & Khan

- Palpal genua with 3 spls...................................................
A. satianaensis Bashir, Afzal & Khan
10 ( 7 ) Venter caudally from coxae II with 7–8 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae).................. 11
- Venter caudally from coxae II with 6 pairs of simple setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae).................... 13

11 ( 10 ) Venter caudally from coxae II with 8 pairs of setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae), apophyses adjoining palpal genua shorter than genu; median shield truncated caudally; tarsal chaetotaxy
I–IV 25 - 23 - 23
- 21 sts........ ..
A. albiziae Den Heyer
- Venter caudally from coxae II with 7 pairs of setae (excluding genital, coxal and anal setae).......................... 12

12 ( 11 ) Apophyses adjoining palpal genua longer than genu; median shield pointed caudally; venter caudally from coxae II with 7 pairs of setae; tarsal chaetotaxy
I–IV 18 - 15 - 13
- 12 sts.....................................
A. asghari Bashir & Afzal

- Apophyses adjoining palpal genua as long as genu; median shield not pointed caudally; venter caudally from coxae II with 7 pairs of setae; tarsal chaetotaxy
I–IV 24 - 24 - 22
- 21 sts.............................
A. brasiliensis Den Heyer & Castro
13 ( 10 ) Tarsus I with more than 27 setae: tarsus II with at least 24 setae................................................. 14
- Tarsus I with less than 25 setae: tarsus II with less than 23 setae................................................ 15

14 ( 13 ) Genital valve with random dot-like lobes; tarsal sts chaetotaxy
I–IV 29 - 25 - 23
- 22 ..........
A. pluri Muhammad & Chardhri

- Genital valve with longitudinal rows of dot-like lobes; tarsal sts chaetotaxy
I–IV 29 - 24 - 22
- 21 .......
A. mactator Den Heyer

15 ( 13 ) Palpal telofemur with 1 apophysis, 2 spls; palpal genu with 1 ap, 2 spls, 2 sts.....................
A. huyssteeni Den Heter
- Palpal telofemur with 1 apophysis, 1 spls; palpal genu with 1 ap, 3 spls, 1 sts..................................... 16

16 ( 15 ) Genu II with 1 asl, 5 sts; genu IV with 2 asl, 5 sts..............................................
A . taurus (Kramer)

- Genu II with 2 asl, 5 sts; genu IV with 1 asl, 4 sts.................................
A. primigenius Skvarla & Dowling

17 ( 4 ) Hysterosomal median shield with a straight or concave frontal margin and with very acute anterior lateral corners (angle less than 45 °)........................................................................................... 18
- Hysterosomal median shield with convex frontal margin and with rounded anterior lateral corners..................... 19
18 ( 17 ) Palpal genu with 1 ap, 2 spls, 1 sts; legs I–IV sts formulae (excluding solenidia): basifemora 1-2 - 1 -0; telofemora 4 - 4 - 4 - 4 ,

; hysterosomal shied width/length = 2.2/ 1 ..........
A. sabrii Bashir, Afzal & Khan
- Palpal genu with 1 ap, 3 spls, 1 sts; legs I–IV sts formulae (excluding solenidia): basifemora 2 - 2 - 1 - 1 ; telofemora 4 - 4 - 4 - 3 , genua 8 - 6 - 6 - 6 ; h
1
3 times the length of c
1
; hysterosomal shied width/length = 1.5/ 1 .......
A. gorjaensis Bashir, Afzal & Khan

paragraph.keyLead:
19 ( 17 ) Apophysis adjoining genu and tibiotarsus shorter than palpal tibiotarsus; telofemoral palpal apophyses three times longer than spine-like seta; distance between the bases of mps—mps 9 times the length of
mps.................... A. bison
(Berlese)

- Apophysis adjoining genu and tibiotarsus longer than palpal tibiotarsus; palpal telofemoral apophyses three times longer than spine-like seta; distance between the bases of mps—mps 5 times the length of
mps.................... A. fixus
(Chaudhri)

22 ( 20 ) 5 pairs of genital setae; palp claw bifid; hysterosomal setae not serrate........................
A. apoensis Corpuz-Raros

- 4 pairs of genital setae; palp claw entire, not bifid; hysterosomal setae serrate......................
A. fuscus (Chaudhri)

25 ( 24 ) Hysterosomal platelets large, as long as median shield; venter caudally from coxae II with 7 pairs of sts (excluding genital and anal setae); palpal telofemur with 1 apophysis...................................................
A. cerris Kalúz

- Hysterosomal platelets ca 1 / 3 the length of median shield; venter caudally from coxae II with 6 pairs of sts (excluding genital and anal setae); palpal telofemur with 2 apophyses..............................................
A. fendai
sp. nov.

30 ( 1 ) Palpal telofemoral apophyses long, reaching apical apophysis on palpal genu; lateral hysterosomal platelets present....... 31

- Palpal telofemoral apophyses short, not reaching apical apophysis on palpal genu; lateral hysterosomal platelets present or absent.............................................................................................. 32

31 ( 30 ) Palpal basifemora with 1 subrectangular apophysis; palp tibiotarsal spls 3 times the length of terminal claw; hysterosomal platelets small, equal in length to c 2 ; coxal chaetotaxy
I–V 3 - 2
-3- 3 ...........................
A. lebowensis Den Heyer

- Palpal basifemur without subrectangular apophysis; palp tibiotarsal spls equal in length to terminal claw; hysterosomal plate- lets long, 2–3 times the length of c 2 ; coxal chaetotaxy
I–V 3 - 1
-3- 1 sts...........................
A. campbelli (Smiley)

; palpal genu chaetotaxy not as above.............................................................................................. 34

34 ( 33 ) Hysterosomal platelets present; palpal genu with 2 spls, 2 sts; basifemora I–IV with 5 - 5 - 4 - 2 sts.......
A. virginiensis Smiley

- Hysterosomal platelets absent; palpal genu with 1 spls, 1 sts; basifemora I–IV with 6 - 6 - 4 - 2 sts..................................................................................................
A. javanus Corpuz-Raros & Gruezo

35 ( 32 ) Palpal telofemoral apophyses as long as width of telofemora; palpal genu with 2 spls, 1 apophysis, 2 sts........................................................................................
A. pennsylvanicus Skvarla & Dowling

- Palpal telofemoral apophyses only 1 / 3 width of telofemora; palpal genu with 1 apophysis, 3 spls, 1 sts.....................................................................................................
A. garciai Corpuz-Raros
